title: double monitors
body:
I saw a post on Imgur a couple of weeks ago showing a guy playing league of legends on two monitors, on his main monitor he was playing the game like normal then on his other monitor he had minimap, I was looking to do this but have no idea how, can anyone help me out??
cheers

replies.body:
Yeah, that looks like he is using a tool to zoom and stretch a part of his screen.
Essentially using screen capture and stretching it to fit the screen.

That site I linked before should do it, but a quick google would probably show a few more tools maybe better.
I unfortunately don't have the time currently to search much more.

But on another note, I feel that would be worse to use that. You physically have to look away from your screen to check the minimap.
Instead of just glancing down every few seconds you are physically turning your head. Seems like a disadvantage to me.
That still wouldn't help 95% of Bronze get map awareness D:

I'm assuming you mean he had a real time minimap, not just an image of the minimap aha
I'm unsure about having a real time minimap on the second monitor, that being said the thought never really crossed my mind sicne my second monitor is for my media/teamspeak/champion  guides occasionally/social media feeds I check during death...

But I know there are programs out there that allow you to zoom in on a particular part of your screen to display it, depending on your graphics card.

How effective these types of solutions are though I'm not quite sure..
You could always give it a crack though.

http://www.dual-monitor.biz/zoom-into-screen-on-windows-computer/
